snippet: The Food and Drug Administration said an outbreak of stomach illnesses in Iowa and Nebraska was linked to salad mix served at Olive Garden and Red Lobster restaurants and supplied by a farm in Mexico.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration says outbreak of stomach illnesses in Iowa and Nebraska is linked to salad mix served at Olive Garden and Red Lobster restaurants supplied by farm in Mexico.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration said an outbreak of stomach illnesses in Iowa and Nebraska was linked to salad mix served at Olive Garden and Red Lobster restaurants and supplied by a farm in Mexico.

headline.main: Outbreak of Stomach Illness Is Traced to a Salad Mix
headline.print_headline: Outbreak Of Stomach Illness Is Traced To a Salad Mix
